alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 3:02PM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Colville, Clark Fork, Deer Park, Moscow, Athol, Spokane Valley, Springdale-Hunters Road, Post Falls, Coeur d`Alene, Plummer, Hayden, Davenport, Downtown Spokane, Bonners Ferry, Metaline, Worley, Eastport, Chewelah, Flowery Trail Road, Kettle Falls, Cheney, Fairfield, Genesee, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Sandpoint, Orin-Rice Road, Tiger, Fruitland, Metaline Falls, Newport, Ione, Priest River, Northport, Airway Heights, Potlatch, and Rockford. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute on Tuesday and the morning and evening commutes on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation at weather.gov/Spokane.

area.areaDesc: Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse; Northern Panhandle
